title.rendered: Gujarat vs Mumbai, India Women’s League 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Gujarat: Beth Mooney (c), Sabbhineni Meghana, Harleen Deol, Ashleigh Gardner, Deandra Dottin, Sushma Verma (wk), Sneh Rana, Georgia Wareham, Mansi Joshi, Annabel Sutherland, Shabnam Md Shakil

Mumbai: Yastika Bhatia (wk), Hayley Matthews, Amelia Kerr, Nat Sciver-Brunt, Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Amanjot Kaur, Pooja Vastrakar, Heather Graham, Saika Ishaque, Issy Wong, Sonam Yadav

Pitch type: Good for batting

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Amanjot Kaur is devastating with the bat down the order and handy with the ball in the middle overs. In her last 10 outings, she has blasted 218 runs at an average of 55 and taken four wickets. Her Best11 percentage during this period reads 70.

With 203 runs at a strike rate of 134, Yastika Bhatia was the top run-getter in the Senior India T20 Trophy.

In her last 10 T20s, Saika Ishaque has taken 12 wickets and registered a top score of 24*.

In the 2022 edition of My11Circle Women’s T20 Challenge, Pooja Vastrakar topped the bowling chart with six wickets at a strike rate of 10.

Sabbhineni Meghana is known for her boundary-hitting skills in the domestic circuit. Her 73 off 47 was the top score in the last edition of T20 Challenger, smashing runs against the likes of Kate Cross, Deepti Sharma, and Ayabonga Khaka, among others.

Besides being a decent batter, Harleen Deol is a fine fielder too, being often placed in the deep for pouching tough catches – potential for more fantasy points.

Sushma Verma has inflicted as many as 13 dismissals in her last eight T20s.

In the Australia Women’s League 2022, Deandra Dottin hammered 362 runs at 28 and scalped 14 wickets including the best figures of two for 20.
